intro: Hetaeria mindanaensis, commonly known as the Mindanao hetaeria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforests, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its botanical features include smooth, glossy stems and showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. Hetaeria mindanaensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
